ygData.subject: RE: Travel Tips - FP & Qeynos
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ll have to make the journey tonight with my Bard alone just to check it out and get the path down set. I ve heard the zone to Lake from the mountains is
ygData.messageBody:
> Trust me, there's PLENTY of room. TONS of it.
> You'd have to specifically want to go to the
> gypsies to hit them. There's so much space you
> can go on either side of them (between them
> and the wall, or around the outside).
>
> Rathetear mountains were made to be the route
> for evil races. =) Besides, even if they
> couldn't, there's a good old thing known as
> invis =)

I'll have to make the journey tonight with my Bard
alone just to check it out and get the path down
set. I've heard the zone to Lake from the mountains
is easily missed.

Second question, from a map of Lake Rathetear I've
seen, it looks like the only way from one side of
the zone to the other (ie: Exit to exit) is by
swimming.. If this is in fact true, will there be
a problem with the deepwater goblins (or other water
nasties) if I swim around the edge just to get
from zone to zone?

Thanks in advance for all the help. I love to travel
and these two zones are 2 of about 10 that I have
yet to be in, in some fashion or another.

As for invisibility, I don't yet have it nor does
he. It's not always easy to find people willing to
help you out with that either; unfortunately.
